{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3599529,"name":"Aishik Chakraborty","username":"AishikC","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/c37758/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-22T03:50:03.716Z","cooked":"

Hello everyone!

I am a member on 112, and have been planning on this potential tool that i think could be very benficial to First.

It is a electrical diagnostic tool that can plug into the Rio/PDH(i still have to decide) and it essentially can diagnose where electrical failures may occur or are occuring such as loss of CAN connection, or low power to certain electronics, and those kinds of errors.

I think this could increase efficiency in Pit Crews, and help teams manage the electrical issues in between matches.

I am trying to plan out the logic of the code and everything it should be able to do. Do you guys have any specifics that the tool should be able to do or detect, or just any general feedback or advice for this project?

  • Thanks!

Hmmm. Seems like a useful idea!

For setting out project charters like this, it’s often useful to start with a value proposition: What problem are you looking to solve? What are alternate solutions to the problem, and why is your proposed solution better?

“Finding electrical faults” Is certainly a good start. Break it down a bit: What sorts of faults can happen? What things cause faults? What is the method of detection on each style of fault? Make a spreadsheet or diagram to help organize your thoughts as you plan out your scope of work.

Having spent many years developing a “fix me!” light for our robot… My casual observation is that many faults will require a human to input how their robot is wired and configured before a fault can be assessed. Plan out carefully how you’ll address this.

One idea that quickly comes to mind, is a wrapper for rev hardware client or phoenix tuner.
Additionally I am more in how the device would actually recognize/display these errors, maybe it could have the possibility of plugging into the CAN chain directly

Nonetheless I am excited to see an outcome!!!
